span.p: Our team is responsible for reporting on the health, performance, usage and happiness of customers using all forms of Windows sign-in including Windows Hello PIN/Face/Fingerprint and password logon, single-sign-on (SSO) to cloud resources and security protocols like TLS that power the web as we know it. Our larger team also owns Data Security including Bitlocker and Windows Information Protection. And finally, Platform Integrity, which includes Secure Boot, Device Guard and Signing.

The “data wave” is well underway in our industry. We recently built a large data science & engineering team in the Windows & Devices Group (WDG) to use insights from data to help create the best experiences on our devices, software, and services. The team has an opportunity to impact the quality of experiences for customers using a whole range of platform security technologies. Our team includes both data scientists who perform analysis and data engineers who make data available for analysis. Together the insights help shape product direction and health.
We’re hiring for our data science group.
The data science group will focus on:
● Power analysis to determine customer happiness with our scenarios.
● Enable leadership to make strategic decisions on product roadmap and investment
● Power both near real time alerting and deep analytics
● Operationalizing data science analysis based on cutting edge techniques in machine learning, semantic analysis, data mining, experiments, statistics, and more
Basic Qualifications:
● Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering or IT related technical discipline
Other Qualifications:
● 2+ years of software development experience.
● Experience with SCOPE/COSMOS scripting or other data analysis technologies
● Solid SQL and Data Analysis skills.
● Strong coding skills in C/C++
● Strong problem solving, testing and debugging skills
● Good communication and cross-group collaboration skills
● Ability to work both independently and collectively in a fun team environment
● High capacity to learn and adapt to new technologies and engineering processes quickly
Skills that are a plus (not required):
● Prior experience with Platform Security and Identity, Authentication Protocols, Biometrics, Credential lifecycle management, PKI and Crypto.
● Product engineering experience working on OS components preferred
● Business Analyst or ML related experience
